title: Language Learning Design and Effectiveness Analysis Using Computer-Based Assessment (CBA)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and experience with online learning environments
context.additional_context: Non-degree language program conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment, aiming to enhance learning engagement and achievement through formative assessment-focused CBA (Continuous and Balanced Assessment)

learning_goals: Establish an assessment strategy that applies CBA (Competency-Based Assessment) design principles to maintain a weekly learning activity balance of over 80%.
Achieve a minimum of 5 hours of weekly learning time when performing CBA within a VLE (Virtual Learning Environment).
Achieve target language proficiency (e.g., a 100-point TOEIC score improvement) by the end of the course through CBA-based formative assessments.
Record a learning satisfaction score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) using various CBA types (quizzes, assignments, discussions).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
